intro: Nicoteba nilgherrensis, commonly known as the Nilgiri nicoteba, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, round berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
